title: Intermediate Course for Inclusive Makerspace Design: Applying Universal Design Principles

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced-level specialized knowledge in the field and extensive practical experience
context.additional_context: A course where current secondary teachers learn inclusive makerspace design methods for science classes. Operates practice-centered sessions using learners' personal devices

learning_goals: Learners create a makerspace activity design document applying the eight principles of universal design (simplicity, collaboration, accessibility, etc.).
Learners develop two inclusive maker projects considering diverse learners and cultural backgrounds.

Within two weeks, learners design one maker education scenario with fail-safe mechanisms, and submit implementation results meeting at least two of three safety requirements (risk detection, alternative operation, automatic shutdown) through peer evaluation and instructor verification.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
